title: Venezuela Live Updates: U.S. Forces Seize Two Tankers, One Under a Russian Flag
summary: The U.S. military intercepted a Russian-flagged tanker as part of its pressure campaign against Venezuela, escalating a conflict with Moscow after ousting its ally, Nicolás Maduro.

title: Maduro Is Gone, but Repression in Venezuela Has Intensified
summary: Security forces have boarded buses, searched phones and interrogated people, looking for evidence that they welcomed the capture of Nicolás Maduro.

title: After Maduro Ouster, Trump’s Venezuela Moves Pose a Challenge for GOP in Congress
summary: Republicans have cheered the raid that ousted Nicolás Maduro but toiled to square their longstanding views with President Trump’s unclear and rapidly evolving strategy.

title: New Dietary Guidelines Abandon Longstanding Advice on Alcohol
summary: Now the government’s recommendation is to “limit” drinking, without specifying safe amounts for men and women. The guidelines no longer warn of risks like cancer.

title: Warner Bros. Board Rebuffs Paramount’s Latest Buyout Offer
summary: The board said the blockbuster deal it reached with Netflix last month posed less risk.

title: Abel Ferrara: In Rome, They Call Him ‘Maestro’
summary: Abel Ferrara, an icon of down-and-dirty New York cinema who has a key role in ‘Marty Supreme,’ tells the story of his wild career in a frank memoir.

title: Fed’s Independence Faces Critical Tests as Trump Seeks to Remake Institution
summary: The central bank faces two major hurdles early on in 2026 that will determine the extent to which it operates free of political meddling.

title: Nick Reiner’s Lawyer, Alan Jackson, Removes Himself From Murder Case
summary: The announcement delayed the arraignment of Mr. Reiner, who is accused of killing his parents last month.

title: As Charlie Kirk’s Turning Point Pushes Into High Schools, Dissension Follows
summary: Since Mr. Kirk’s death, chapters of his organization’s affiliate for teenagers have more than doubled in number, aided by politicians who have said they won’t tolerate opposition.

title: Yemen Separatist Leader Refuses to Attend Talks, Deepening Saudi Arabia-UAE Clash
summary: Southern Yemen has been engulfed in a proxy conflict that pits two U.S. allies, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, against each other.

title: Hundreds of Tourists on Yemeni Island Caught Up in Saudi-U.A.E. Rift
summary: Around 600 foreigners have been stranded on Socotra as clashes on mainland Yemen halted flights, turning the nature sanctuary and tourist spot into a geopolitical trap.

title: Tests for Autism? Companies Are Selling Them, but Research Is Still Scant
summary: Backers claim the tests can predict a child’s risk of autism using a strand of hair or a mother’s blood, but critics say they are not ready for the market.

title: New Novels to Read This Year
summary: Tayari Jones, Ann Patchett, George Saunders and Veronica Roth return with new novels; Jennette McCurdy makes her fiction debut; and more.

title: New Nonfiction Books to Read This Year
summary: Memoirs by Sylvester Stallone and the founder of Barstool Sports; essays from celebrated novelists Jesmyn Ward and Jayne Anne Phillips; and more.

title: Minnesota’s Fraud Should Be a Wake-Up Call for Democrats
summary: The specter of welfare fraud haunted Democrats under Reagan. It could do so again.

title: A Defense of U.S. Intervention in Venezuela
summary: The former envoy Elliott Abrams says the administration should push harder for regime change.

title: The Law of the Jungle
summary: We ask where America’s new foreign policy might take us — and the world.

title: Ronny Chieng Remarks on Trump ‘DoorDash-ing’ Maduro to Brooklyn
summary: “The Daily Show” host quipped that after a surprise capture, Nicolás Maduro “will face justice in the best legal system in the world that we illegally kidnapped him to.”

title: China’s Threat to Block Rare Earths Has Put Japan on High Alert
summary: Tokyo is concerned at signs that Beijing may be laying the groundwork to restrict access to the metals vital to manufacturing.

title: What to Know About the Vaccines Cut From C.D.C. Recommendations
summary: Federal health officials upended the immunization schedule for American children this week. These are the diseases affected.

title: Alaska Airlines to Buy 110 Boeing Planes as It Seeks to Expand
summary: Alaska’s order, its largest ever, follows its acquisition of Hawaiian Airlines and is part of its plan to expand, including overseas.

title: Reshuffle at Ukraine’s Intelligence Agencies Draws Criticism
summary: Some ask whether the shake-up risks disrupting the agencies’ operations and is political in nature.
